lines.text: Now, w-where did I put that screwdriver? I bet I l-left it in the oven.
[Looks inside oven with a lit match]
Ah, h-here it is.
No accidents in the home, eh? You should never use a match to look in the oven.
Oh, f-f-fiddlesticks.
You should use a flashlight, like so.
[Peeks inside oven with flashlight; it explodes]
Must have been a short in my battery.
I just gotta prove this meatball that the home is loaded with pitfalls. Aha, the hall closet.
[Peeks in closet, which is full to bursting]
Aha, just as I thought. A veritable booby trap. I'll just prime it a little.
[Adds more stuff, then goes to Porky]
Do you have a tennis racket I could borrow?
N-no, I don't.
Hmm. Water skis?
Uh-uh.
Golf clubs?
N-n-no.
Outrigger canoe?
N-n-no, I don't.
Croquet set? Elephant gun? Sidesaddle?
N-n-no.
A yo-yo?
W-why yes.
Well, where is it?
R-right there in the hall closet.
Why didn't you say so in the first place?
[Runs to hall closet and opens door; all the stuff falls on him; emerges with yo-yo]
Good morning, sir. I represent the Hotfoot Casualty Underwriters Insurance Company of Schenectady.
B-b-but I...
As everybody knows, most accidents occur right around the home. A Hot Foot accident policy pays you for any injury incurred in the home.
B-b-but I, b-b-but I...
For instance, Hotfoot pays you one million dollars for a black eye.
B-but I don't wa... One million dollars for a b-black eye?
Oh, of course, there are a few minor provisions. I'll read it to you.
[Puts earmuffs on Porky]
00 p.m., during a hailstorm."
[Removes earmuffs]
Did that come through okay?
Why...
All right, just sign here on the dotted line.
Oh, b-but I don't want a policy. I n-never have accidents in my home. Now you'll have to excuse me, I have a g-great deal to do today. Good day, sir.
[escorts Daffy out the door]
Oh, he doesn't have accidents in his home, eh?

[Dazed from all the mishaps he had to endure]
I represent the something-or-other insurance company. Could I interest you in an accident policy?
Why, c-certainly.
Our policy... What did you say?
After w-w-witnessing your unfortunate mishaps about the house, I'm r-ready to sign on the dotted line. T-t-there, now all I have to do to get a million dollars is get a b-black eye.
00 p.m. on the Fourth of July during a hailstorm.
[Evil laugh]
I kn-kn-knew there'd be a catch to it.
[Suddenly a pack of elephants stampede into Porky's house]
Stampede of wild elephants!
[Looks at watch]
[Hears marching music outside; looks at calendar]
Fourth of July!
[Sticks head out door, is pelted with hailstones]
Hail storm! Oh, no!
Oh, yes. A b-b-black eye. Pay me.
Oh, no. It distinctly says "a stampede of wild elephants and one baby zebra."
[Aside to audience]
I just added that one.
[Suddenly a baby zebra runs into the living room, trampling Daffy]
And one baby zebra.
